==Trivia==
*The Chinese name for this talent, {{Lang|White Board Kung Fu|zh=白案功夫}}, comes from Chinese restaurant terminology. A {{zh|白案|tl=white board}} chef plays a similar role held by a {{w|pastry chef}} in Western restaurants, and is in charge of dough-related dishes, particularly tasks such as making handmade noodles and dumplings. In contrast, a {{zh|红案|tl=red board}} chef handles the preparation and cooking of meat. 
**The English name is a portmanteau of "dough" and "kung-fu." Coincidentally, "dough-fu" sounds very close to the Chinese pronunciation of tofu ({{zh|豆腐|rm=dòufu}}).
